content.question: For time <math alttext="t greater than equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>, the position of an object moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="x of t equals, one third times t cubed, minus 2 times t squared, plus 3 t, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following statements about the object is true at time <math alttext="t equals 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: The object is moving to the right and slowing down.
The object is moving to the right and speeding up.
The object is moving to the left and slowing down.
The object is moving to the left and speeding up.

content.answer: The object is moving to the right and slowing down.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration
